location: 8 km east of Palma, Mallorca island

primary: Spanish AESA (Agencia Estatal de Seguridad Aérea)
Palma de Mallorca Airport Official Authority
secondary: Ground handling providers (Swissport, Menzies, Just Aviation)

operational_hours.notes: 24/7 operations year-round with no curfew restrictions. Control tower operational continuously. Continuous customs and immigration processing available.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: High during summer peak (June-September), moderate off-season
slot_requirements.notes: Slots required for scheduled operations. Non-scheduled (charter) flights require AESA landing permit (24-48 hour processing). Parking confirmation only 15 days pre-arrival during summer peak.

weather_vulnerability.notes: Mediterranean climate ensures excellent weather reliability. Fog extremely rare; snow virtually impossible. Occasional thunderstorms October-November but minimal disruption. Wind generally not a limiting factor. Overall among Europe's most weather-reliable airports.

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: No specified weight restrictions; accommodates international traffic
runway_specifications.notes: Modern long runways suitable for international commercial traffic. Both runways equipped with precision approach lighting (ALSF-I, ALSF-II, REIL-OMNI). Capable of handling large wide-body aircraft.

crew_requirements.minimum_pilot_hours: Not specified; EASA Part-FCL requirements apply
crew_requirements.notes: Standard EASA licensing requirements (Regulation 1178/2011) for operations to Spain. No special qualifications required. Straightforward operations for standard aircrews.

handling_complexity.notes: Multiple handlers available: Swissport, Menzies Aviation, Just Aviation, Acciona. Fuel suppliers include Air BP, Vitol Aviation, Shell Aviation. 24/7 ground services. Customs typically completed within 30-60 minutes. Saturday/Sunday surcharges apply.

congestion_metrics.notes: Summer season (June-August) sees 3x normal traffic. 2024 traffic data shows consistent operations. Peak delays during 09:00-17:00 in summer. Efficient ground operations minimize taxi times. Winter operations smooth with minimal delays.

permits_and_clearances.notes: EU-registered aircraft: no permit required for scheduled operations. Non-scheduled (charter): AESA landing permit needed (3-month advance recommended for peak season). EU/Schengen streamlined processing. Mandatory ADS-B equipped.

noise_restrictions.chapter_requirements: No formal strict restrictions; Spanish noise regulations apply
noise_restrictions.preferred_departure_routes: Standard SIDs, coastal routing to minimize land overflight
noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: Low-Medium (tourist-heavy airport, limited residential noise impacts)
noise_restrictions.notes: No severe noise restrictions like northern European airports. Reverse thrust limitations during night hours (2100-0500 and 2200-0600). Boeing/Airbus standard noise procedures apply. Limited noise complaint history due to location and residential patterns.

infrastructure_reliability.notes: Modern international airport infrastructure. Backup power systems in place. Well-maintained facilities. Minimal closure history. Joint civil/military operations add redundancy.

security_requirements.enhanced_security_periods: During elevated threat levels, summer peak
security_requirements.notes: EU/Schengen security standards. ETIAS implementation May 2025 for non-EU visitors. Enhanced security during summer tourist season. Fast-track and VIP procedures available. Standard EU protocols apply.

seasonal_factors.high_season_months: June-September (summer tourism), Easter holidays, Christmas/New Year
seasonal_factors.holiday_peak_dates: Easter (March-April), Mid-July to mid-August (peak summer), December holidays
seasonal_factors.notes: Extreme summer season peak (June-August) with 3x normal traffic. Tourism-driven congestion. Winter mild (~57-63°F day temps). Virtually no winter weather disruptions. Overall excellent year-round operations.

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Valencia and Alicante are primary alternates for larger aircraft. Ibiza and Menorca (LEM) closer for smaller aircraft. All have customs/immigration services. Relatively isolated location on island increases alternate importance.

payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Typically post-delivery; credit terms available for established operators
payment_and_fees.notes: AENA (airport operator) charges per aircraft size and operation type. Handling fees variable by provider. EU-regulated fee structure. Weekend/night surcharges 20-40% typical. Competitive pricing due to multiple handlers.

primary_risk_factors: Extreme seasonal congestion (3x summer multiplier June-August)
Limited parking availability during peak (15-day confirmation window)
High volume tourist traffic affecting airport infrastructure
Landing permit requirements for non-scheduled operations
advantages: Excellent ground services with multiple handlers
Competitive fuel pricing due to handler competition
No weather-related delays (fog/snow/ice virtually never occur)
operational_summary.key_operational_considerations: Palma is a high-volume tourist destination airport suitable for year-round operations. Critical advantage: 24/7 operations enable scheduling flexibility unavailable at many European airports. Weather is exceptionally reliable. Peak season (June-August) requires advance coordination—parking must be confirmed, slots pre-booked, and handling arranged minimum 15 days ahead. Off-season (November-April) offers smooth operations with minimal congestion. Ground handling is efficient and competitively priced. Landing permits for charter flights require 24-48 hours but are routinely granted. Excellent alternate airports nearby. Airport location on island increases alternate importance but alternatives are readily available.
